snippet: Sixty years ago this month the Syracuse Nationals won their only N.B.A. title in a dramatic seven-game series. The city has never forgotten, and a local hockey team paid tribute Friday to the hard-nosed players who made it happen.
abstract: Local hockey team Syracuse Crunch holds pre-game ceremony recognizing members of Syracuse Nationals, NBA team now known as Philadelphia 76ers, who once played in the same arena over a half century earlier; former Syracuse Nationals players Jim Tucker, Billy Kenville and Dolph Schayes are honored on 60th anniversary of their 1955 NBA championship win against Fort Wayne Pistons.
lead_paragraph: Sixty years ago this month the Syracuse Nationals won their only N.B.A. title in a dramatic seven-game series. The city has never forgotten, and a local hockey team paid tribute Friday to the hard-nosed players who made it happen.

headline.main: Tribute on Ice to Gritty Competitors Who Made Syracuse the King of the N.B.A.
headline.print_headline: Kings of the Hardwoods Honored on Syracuse Ice
